title: Why exactly can't the New Jungle be a bit weaker on champions Riot?
body:
From a distance I adore the jungle changes, I like the new items, the new smite system, and the buffs.

I am not too big a fan of the monsters kicking me and twisting my soul til my champion is sobbing in the corner.

I am also not a huge fan of how I am always 2 levels behind no matter how many kills I manage to grab while ganking.

However, my real question and point of interest is why the jungle monsters have to hurt so much in the first place? I figure a jungle that is less dangerous means more champions can actually do it, which is what you want, more diversity. And I know, regardless of what is done we are going to see a group of champions that are more common then the rest, but I have to ask why not nerf the monsters, and buff the lanes a bit?

I am not an expert and don't really stalk your threads and replies to people, but the jungle is the way it is right now to make the jungler not come out of the jungle as a demi god, after all someone who's prime objective is gaining control over the map shouldn't be able to destroy the laners, I am actually fine with the jungle not giving as much as laners. (I still want more gold and XP, nothing crazy but to keep up just a little better)

So I figure instead of making the jungle increasingly difficult we just give laners a small buff to make them stay ahead still, nothing major of course, but then our precious tank junglers, adc junglers, mage junglers etc, Can actually jungle, farm up, but not go into lane and dominate everything. I am sure this has been thought up already, but all the focus has been soley on the jungle and no changes to the lane, so maybe to fix the problems we just move our focus away from the jungle creeps.

And uh. Yeah.


Edit- If you look at my match history you will see I played Nautilus, first time in like 2 months or something, I wanted better context and understanding about him and the current jungle, and let me just say this now... He clears it better then before, I still think he needs a wee buff to his level 1 shield, but honestly he clears better then season 4.

I ended up being really coordinated with my ganks, mainly because 3 of us were in a skype call, I was still behind in levels, despite getting plenty of kills and ganks early on, and my gold situation wasn't as much, I mean it was bad, but its not hard to be a CC machine. Just rushed Warmogs and I was set.


Mainly the point of this is I have a somewhat altered opinion that maybe we just should just go back to buffing the champions who can't jungle well and fix the XP/Gold issue.

You're not picking good sustain junglers then or picking good rune/masteries. Fiddlesticks can solo dragon at lvl 1. I even made a lvl 2 dragon guide here:

I also have no problem sustaining lvls and ganks w/ S-tier jungle champs. Go w/ what's already broken until Riot fixes it. Use them to your advantage.

Well no, I play Fiddle, Warwick, Voli etc.

I don't want to just sit and play sustain junglers, that isn't any fun. Even still your under leveled and gold starved a lot.
I don't understand how you stay under leveled. With proper ganks I've been able to get even above the levels and gold of my own teammates. How is it that you're having a hard time?

Well it isn't just me, Its everyone. You are literally the only person to say otherwise, I still watch League videos on Youtube every day, same thing, I think its the same in LCS, I really wouldn't know, I find it boring.

Gold isn't a problem later in the game, because then everyone is able to just farm and clear waves. Early on though you are pretty gold starved.

And I don't know what you define as a proper gank, but even if I ganked all 3 lanes and got the kill, I would still end up under leveled.

Really? By mid-game, I've usually managed to gank as Nocturne two or three times. Even when I'm 1/0/2 or 2/0/1, I still barely manage to be at the same level as the team support. Ganking doesn't add XP, it substitutes for the XP I'd get from continuing to farm jungle, especially since I'm usually splitting kill XP with at least one other person.
Because then people wouldn't be forced to play the #LC$BIGPLAY$ champs like Lee and J4.
I would prefer you kept talk like that somewhere else, it adds nothing to the discussion and all it does is provoke people to bash Riot.
You asked a question and I gave an answer. There is no other reason. Look at which 2 champs aren't hurt by the increase item cost lol.

The change wasn't nearly as drastic as made out to be, even Nautilus didn't suffer as much as people predicted. Riot posted a nice explained post about the change and its intended effects, and what they are going to do further. Nothing to do with what you said.
On the contrary (to what SN2 said), Nautilus is actually quite viable now. I know he can clear everything but raptors on the first clear (though I always avoid raptors first clear).
Raptors are hell spawns..

No offense, but you've only been playing since Season 4 and EVERY good jungler I see in ranked ends up getting 1st - 2nd place on gold by the end of the game and they usually get the level lead if they get the kills. I don't know what you mean by "everyone," but if "everyone" says they're being deprived to you, and "everyone" I see that's a good jungler is getting great ganks and having high sustain, I don't understand how we're playing the same game.

I have been playing since Season 3, I haven't heavily played the Jungle until Season 4.

One of the major issues with the jungle is the lack of XP and being behind in levels, I witness it every game. 

Watch some of Stonewall008's videos for example, one of the videos he is 4/0 during the laning phase and still behind in levels. (He got first blood too I believe)  Spectate those featured ranked matches and see it happening too.

If you have some proof stating otherwise you can share it, but I haven't really found anyone saying they haven't had XP problems in the jungle.

And gold is a problem Early and Early mid game, late game of course the jungler will catch up in farm, he is able to CS lanes freely.
^ This. You can be a very successful ganker and still be behind in levels (though not in gold).

So you wouldn't see Season 3 data anyway.

Since no one here has given the answer allow me to repeat what I remember from what they said when they chose to leave the S4 jungle.

Basically, in an easy jungle where anyone can jungle, ability to jungle either quickly or safely ceases to be a factor in deciding what champs are strong.  Which in turn means that junglers are forced to pick champs that are really strong at something else.  It turns out this something else is ganking.  Hence only champs with amazing gank ability got picked for LCS and balance couldn't easily change that.  In other words, the too easy jungle forced the pros to play only one type of jungle.  The exception to this was nunu, and that was only because he was able to turn himself into a support with a sightstone and not suffer too much and give good objective control.  The other top picks were chose for their ability to gank.  Olaf (recent LCS) and Sej (recent IEM) could never have been picked in the S4 jungle at a competitive level.  Is the new jungle perfect by any stretch of the imagination?  no.  I honestly don't know how to create the jungle they want where multiple types of junglers are viable.  But I like their goal and I agree that an easy jungle is a failed experiment for them at this point.

Well its impossible to make a jungle completely viable for all types of junglers, making it stronger just means sustained junglers rule. 

A lot more ganking junglers then sustained, especially with the smite changes allowing you to slow people or steal MS.

I am familiar with the latest set of ops in the jungle.  And it does seem impossible, but I have seen riot innovate and come up with creative ideas to do things that I thought couldn't be done.  Do I expect them to come up with a way to make pros pick all the possible jungle styles? not really.  But part of me thinks they might yet find a way to get it up to three types of jungling (which would be amazing).  Either way, the reason they will not go back to the S4 jungle is because that path has been tried and they are not satisfied with failure.  If you can find a new way to make an "soft"/"easy" jungle they may reconsider the point, but it would have to be something that gives incentive to "increase champion diversity"

I figured making it easier for junglers, and buffing the laners a bit. Junglers don't end up overpowered but laners aren't drastically ahead anymore.

Someone mentioned easier clears meant ganking junglers take over, and the ones who aren't great at ganking become the unviable ones. But with the smite changes, they have the ability to slow and steal movement speed now, as well as i think a weaker version of ignite for one? So then none of the junglers really fall out, of course the best of the best are going to be picked.

I mean I can be completely misunderstanding everything, and not seeing a bigger picture to this, but it seems easier this way then trying whatever they are currently doing.

I'm finding the jungle's gold to be alright.  I do wish junglers got more xp though.  It makes ganking a lane where your laner is down a little really hard, since the enemy laner could be 2 levels ahead of me.  Sure, I'm not going to gank a lane where my teammate is 0/3/0 - but if they're 1/2/0, a gank could do a lot to turn things back in their favor, assuming I can survive it and pull it off.

Gold isn't nearly as bad, I think a small buff to how much gold we get with the machete items is all we need.

The XP needs to be fixed though, Its really dangerous going against the enemy mid laner who can easily burst you down when your 4 and they are 6.

NOOOOO, the jungle is great now. Riot nerfed stone items because early game gankers were a problem. You see, lee sin, vi, j4 were wrecking lanes.

Now with the new jungle lots of jungler are getting kicked out and you se diversity, like lee sin, vi and j4.
Except all 3 of those people are still on top and viable. What you said makes no sense.
You missed the joke :3

In season 4, the jungle was without a doubt the easiest and safest way to carry a game. It wasn't balanced with the other lanes. The XP nerfs really had to happen. With that, junglers are now hyper dependent on farming efficiently between ganks, and one of the biggest problems with farming efficiently is laners poaching the jg farm when they lost lane. They made the jungle monsters hurt so much to make it difficult for laners without machete to poach the jungle's shit before mid game. They even made it so that laners can't even bring machete without smite for extra caution.

Even then, The jungle hurts to much, I thought giving decreased gold for laners and increased for junglers was enough to help with that.

I am not sure why the spawn timers had to be increased if farming between ganks was the intended route, it just makes that difficult as well.
It increases global map presence in that just camping bot and farming botside jg is more punishing.
How did we come from an almost perfect jungle of Season 4 to this mess?

I don't think it was perfect, honestly I jungled all the time and enjoyed it, but it was really repetitive, no real challenge to me. I mean yes now the monsters are overpowered, but an actual challenge. Now I have to worry about scuttle crab vision, dragon control, and using my smite more effectively.
I said almost perfect for a reason lol. Dragon, Baron, Crabs, and Smites are a great change but they essentially took several steps back on everything else.
Which is the problem they are working towards, and the point of my post. To find a way to fix those several steps back :P
